channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mike Rogers in consideration for FBI chief after meeting in Mar-a-Lago with Trump transition team, sources say
item.description: Former FBI special agent and former Rep. Mike Rogers of Michigan, the 2024 Senate nominee in the key battleground state, met with Trump transition off...

item.title: Trial begins for the man accused of killing Georgia nursing student Laken Riley
item.description: Opening statements began Friday in the trial of the man accused of killing a Georgia nursing student, in a case that helped fan the immigration debate...

item.title: The Senate Should Reject Matt Gaetz
item.description: He is a self-absorbed provocateur who has no relevant experience for such an important job.

item.title: From biopharma to real estate to shipping, top CEOs insist AI is worth the hype
item.description: Stop being afraid of newfangled technology, and start letting your kids use it to help them with their homework, said panelists at Fortune Global Foru...

item.title: Trump killing the EV tax credit would hurt Tesla but be catastrophic for Elon Musk’s competition, analysts say
item.description: Musk seems to favor pulling up the ladder that he used to climb the auto industry.

item.title: Nixon Can Teach Trump About The Pitfalls Of Revenge Politics
item.description: The same types of angry diversions that consumed Democrats over the past eight years could easily undo Republican governance.

item.title: RFK Jr. and Our Big, Fat Controversies
item.description: I’m pretty sure that Kennedy is a crank, generally. But he’s not wrong when it comes to some basic arguments about food and nutrition in America.

item.title: The Week: Trump Staffs Up
item.description: Plus: Pope Francis encourages the Saints.

item.title: NFL Fines Player For MAGA Hat After Paying Kaepernick Millions Over His Kneeling Stunt
item.description: The NFL only wants to give the appearance of allowing the players freedom of expression while controlling which messages can be expressed and which ca...

item.title: Book Review: The M&A Failure Trap
item.description: Massive M&A deals make headlines but too rarely make money for stockholders.

item.title: America’s Adversaries Don’t Want Marco Rubio To Be The Next Secretary Of State
item.description: Rubio has proven himself as a hawk against America's most dangerous adversary: China.

item.title: Elon Musk blasts John Bolton as 'staggeringly dumb warmonger' after criticism of Trump AG pick Matt Gaetz
item.description: Elon Musk called John Bolton "a staggeringly dumb warmonger" and suggested that Bolton's opposition to someone is "a great sign!"

item.title: Escaping the Benchmark Trap: A Guide for Smarter Investing
item.description: Is it time to eschew the benchmark trap in favor of Warren Buffett's rule, "Don't lose capital?"

item.description: President-elect Donald Trump marked a pivotal shift in his goal of reshaping the U.S. energy landscape with his pick of North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum ...

item.description: What makes most investors believe that private capital funds are such clear outperformers? The use of since-inception internal rate of return (IRR) as...

item.title: Will Democrats Now Become Born-Again Federalists?
item.description: Red-state arguments against federal-government overreach will now be dusted off in service of blue-state priorities. Good.

item.title: Why legendary Domino’s founder Tom Monaghan formed a board entirely consisting of children aged 8-12
item.description: Monaghan genuinely believed that children are honest, have lots of ideas, and are willing to share them.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy Agenda Must Start By Undoing Four Years Of Global Insolvency
item.description: American resources are limited. We must address the greatest threats from large, powerful countries like China first, then everyone else.

item.title: Meet Pete Hegseth: The 'recovering neocon' and Pentagon critic who's been tapped for Defense secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump sent shock waves through the national security establishment when he nominated Pete Hegseth for Defense secretary.

item.title: Fetterman defends Casey-McCormick recount as challenger’s team says 'zero' path for Democrat
item.description: Pennsylvania Democratic Sen. John K. Fetterman talked to Fox News Digital about the Casey-McCormick race now headed for automatic recount.

item.title: Rep Moulton says fellow Dems 'privately' agree with his criticism of party
item.description: Rep. Seth Moulton is urging fellow House Democrats to have serious conversations about the direction of the party and how it tolerates dissenting view...

item.title: Trump Should Revive His Pro-America 1776 Commission On Day One
item.description: Young Americans’ historical and civic illiteracy is a danger to the Republic, and it cannot be allowed to continue.

item.title: The world has only deployed 10% of the climate technologies it needs to achieve net zero, new research by McKinsey shows
item.description: 12 challenges are particularly demanding—and 40 to 60% of the CO2 emissions of the energy system cannot be abated unless they are tackled.

item.title: A Guide for Investment Analysts: Working with Historical Market Data
item.description: Interested in working with older historical data? Pitfalls lurk for the unwary.

item.title: How this architectural engineering firm built sustainability into its business
item.description: Companies can build trust by showing that they take the climate crisis seriously, says CEO of PAE Christian Agulles.

item.title: Red One’s Instant Bamboozle
item.description: The Rock and Chris Evans peddle cynicism and surrogacy for Christmas.
